articles.headline: Biden Tells Republicans to ‘Show Some Spine’ Against Trump on Border Deal
articles.snippet: President Biden accused the House GOP of thwarting legislation tightening immigration rules and providing aid to Ukraine and Israel out of fear of their 2024 front-runner, Donald Trump.
articles.abstract: President Biden accused the House GOP of thwarting legislation tightening immigration rules and providing aid to Ukraine and Israel out of fear of their 2024 front-runner, Donald Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden took the border fight directly to former President Donald J. Trump on Tuesday, blaming his predecessor and putative challenger for torpedoing a bipartisan immigration agreement out of crass politics at the expense of national security.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Catie Edmondson

articles.headline: A Last-Minute Trip to What May Be the Priciest Super Bowl Ever: Around $9,859 Per Person
articles.snippet: Thinking of a splurge to see the big game in Las Vegas this weekend? You’ll be competing with billionaires who are going to “have trouble parking their planes.”
articles.abstract: Thinking of a splurge to see the big game in Las Vegas this weekend? You’ll be competing with billionaires who are going to “have trouble parking their planes.”
articles.lead_paragraph: So you want to go to the Super Bowl this weekend. Even for non-football fans, this year’s spectacle of professional sports and over-the-top entertainment — in Las Vegas, no less — could be hard to resist.

articles.headline: Mother of Michigan Gunman Found Guilty of Manslaughter
articles.snippet: Jennifer Crumbley was convicted on four counts of involuntary manslaughter, one for each student her son killed in Michigan’s deadliest school shooting.
articles.abstract: Jennifer Crumbley was convicted on four counts of involuntary manslaughter, one for each student her son killed in Michigan’s deadliest school shooting.
articles.lead_paragraph: Michigan jurors, after 11 hours of deliberations, found Jennifer Crumbley guilty of involuntary manslaughter on Tuesday for the gun rampage committed by her teenage son, who carried out the state’s deadliest school shooting more than two years ago.

articles.headline: Alaska Airlines 737 May Have Left Boeing Factory Missing Bolts, N.T.S.B. Says
articles.snippet: A photo indicates that bolts in a fuselage panel were removed at a Boeing factory and not replaced, the National Transportation Safety Board said.
articles.abstract: A photo indicates that bolts in a fuselage panel were removed at a Boeing factory and not replaced, the National Transportation Safety Board said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Four bolts used to secure the panel that ultimately blew off an Alaska Airlines plane during a flight last month were removed — and appear not to have been replaced — at Boeing’s factory in Renton, Wash., according to a preliminary report released Tuesday by the National Transportation Safety Board.
articles.byline: By Sydney Ember and Mark Walker

articles.headline: King Pushed for Transparency on Diagnosis. He Raised Questions in the Process.
articles.snippet: The king has let people know more about his health than other monarchs, but a decision to keep private the form of cancer he has is leading to speculation in lieu of facts.
articles.abstract: The king has let people know more about his health than other monarchs, but a decision to keep private the form of cancer he has is leading to speculation in lieu of facts.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Buckingham Palace announced on Monday that King Charles III had been diagnosed with cancer and would halt his public engagements to undergo treatment, it predictably set off a storm of questions.

articles.headline: ‘My Everything — Gone in a Matter of Moments’
articles.snippet: Six months after the Maui wildfire, hundreds of businesses remain closed, and questions linger about how much a local economy should rely on tourism.
articles.abstract: Six months after the Maui wildfire, hundreds of businesses remain closed, and questions linger about how much a local economy should rely on tourism.
articles.lead_paragraph: Twisted and charred aluminum mixed with shards of glass still lines the floor of the industrial warehouse where Victoria Martocci once operated her scuba diving business. After a wildfire tore through West Maui, all that remained of her 36-foot boat, the Extended Horizons II, were a pair of engines.
articles.byline: By Kurtis Lee and Brendan George Ko

articles.headline: How Ford’s F-150 Lightning, Once in Hot Demand, Lost Its Luster
articles.snippet: Some buyers said the electric Lightning did not meet expectations, and Ford has slashed its production plans for the pickup because sales are lagging.
articles.abstract: Some buyers said the electric Lightning did not meet expectations, and Ford has slashed its production plans for the pickup because sales are lagging.
articles.lead_paragraph: In July Michael Puglia drove home with what seemed like the coolest vehicle he’d ever own — a Ford F-150 Lightning electric pickup truck.

articles.headline: Vision Pro Review: Apple’s First Headset Lacks Polish and Purpose
articles.snippet: Billed as the future of computing, the $3,500 goggles can’t replace a laptop for work. At times, wearing them also made our columnist feel nauseated.
articles.abstract: Billed as the future of computing, the $3,500 goggles can’t replace a laptop for work. At times, wearing them also made our columnist feel nauseated.
articles.lead_paragraph: About 17 years ago, Steve Jobs took the stage at a San Francisco convention center and said he was introducing three products: an iPod, a phone and an internet browser.

articles.headline: For First Time in Two Decades, U.S. Buys More From Mexico Than China
articles.snippet: The United States bought more goods from Mexico than China in 2023 for the first time in 20 years, evidence of how much global trade patterns have shifted.
articles.abstract: The United States bought more goods from Mexico than China in 2023 for the first time in 20 years, evidence of how much global trade patterns have shifted.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the depths of the pandemic, as global supply chains buckled and the cost of shipping a container from China soared nearly twentyfold, Marco Villarreal spied an opportunity.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Simon Romero

articles.headline: Who Created Butter Chicken? India’s Great Curry Clash.
articles.snippet: A court has been asked to solve a bitter dispute between two families who have very different accounts of the origins of a dish beloved around the world.
articles.abstract: A court has been asked to solve a bitter dispute between two families who have very different accounts of the origins of a dish beloved around the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 1947, two men, both named Kundan, fled Peshawar during the bloody partition that carved Pakistan out of British India. They landed in Delhi and soon became partners in a restaurant called Moti Mahal serving food from the Punjab region.
articles.byline: By Suhasini Raj and Anindito Mukherjee
